intro: Chrysochlamys membranacea, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. Its botanical features make it a unique addition to horticultural collections.
